ThingDef.label: avian paragon egg (unfert.)
ThingDef.description: Unfertilized avian paragon egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. These eggs are pure, pristine, perfect examples of chicken eggs. Immaculate eggness.

ThingDef.label: avian paragon egg (fert.)
ThingDef.description: Fertilized avian paragon egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. These eggs are pure, pristine, perfect examples of chicken eggs. Immaculate eggness. If all goes well, it should hatch into an avian paragon.

ThingDef.label: reptile paragon egg (unfert.)
ThingDef.description: Unfertilized reptile paragon egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked.

ThingDef.label: reptile paragon egg (fert.)
ThingDef.description: Fertilized reptile paragon egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. If all goes well, it should hatch into a reptile paragon.

ThingDef.description: Unfertilized bearchicken egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked.

ThingDef.label: bearchicken egg (fert.)
ThingDef.description: Fertilized bearchicken egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into one of these abominations. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.

ThingDef.label: chickenrabbit egg (unfert.)
ThingDef.description: Unfertilized Chickenrabbit egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. The colonists swear it was coloured like this when the animal laid it.

ThingDef.label: chickenrabbit egg (fert.)
ThingDef.description: Fertilized Chickenrabbit egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into one of these abominations. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked. The colonists swear it was coloured like this when the animal laid it.

ThingDef.label: chickenspider egg (unfert.)
ThingDef.description: Unfertilized Chickenspider egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Since insectoid hybrids are always infertile, these eggs can never be fertilized.
